definitions.definition: A spending or consuming, often a disbursement of funds.
definitions.example: Buying the car was a big expense, but will be worth it in the long run.

definitions.definition: The elimination or consumption of something, sometimes with the notion of loss or damage to the thing eliminated.
definitions.example: Jones reached the final at the expense of Smith, who couldn't beat him.

definitions.definition: To charge a cost against an expense account; to bill something to the company for which one works.
definitions.example: It should be acceptable to expense a business lunch with a client.
